question.title: Jose4j - Getting array out of bound exception
question.body:
I am using the jose JOSE4j Â» 0.9.6 library and I am passing a jwt token to

jwtConsumer.processToClaims(
    tokenString)

method to the following class

org.jose4j.jwt.consumer.JwtConsumer

Post which I am getting array out of bound index,
**error: java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: Index 4355 out of bounds for length 4355,
error: java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: Index 3634 out of bounds for length 3634,
**
and so on for multiple different tokens.
I suspect the issue coming from method

processContext

originalJoseObjects.subList(idx + 1, originalJoseObjects.size());

which eventually goes to

static void subListRangeCheck(int fromIndex, int toIndex, int size) {
    if (fromIndex < 0)
        throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException("fromIndex = " + fromIndex);
    if (toIndex > size)
        throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException("toIndex = " + toIndex);
    if (fromIndex > toIndex)
        throw new IllegalArgumentException("fromIndex(" + fromIndex +
                                           ") > toIndex(" + toIndex + ")");
}

wanted to check if anyone else faced any such issue, or there is any reason we get this error.
Any help would be appreciated.

1 important update - i am running my code on java 21 with spring boot 3.5.3.
